docs.title: Welcome to MkDocs
docs.text: For full documentation visit mkdocs.org.

docs.title: Commands
docs.text:
• mkdocs new [dir-name] - Create a new project.
  • mkdocs serve - Start the live-reloading docs server.
  • mkdocs build - Build the documentation site.
  • mkdocs -h - Print help message and exit.

docs.title: Project layout
docs.text:
mkdocs.yml    # The configuration file.
docs/
    index.md  # The documentation homepage.
    ...       # Other markdown pages, images and other files.

I like to drink whatever after I played

docs.title: admonitions
docs.text:
Title of the callout

Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet, consectetur adipiscing elit. Nulla et euismod nulla. Curabitur feugiat, tortor non consequat finibus, justo purus auctor massa, nec semper lorem quam in massa.

Collapsible callout:

Collapsible callout

Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet, consectetur adipiscing elit. Nulla et euismod nulla. Curabitur feugiat, tortor non consequat finibus, justo purus auctor massa, nec semper lorem quam in massa.

Go to documentation for more admonitions https://squidfunk.github.io/mkdocs-material/reference/admonitions/

docs.title: Markdown Code Block Language Tags with Examples
docs.text: Use fenced code blocks like this:

docs.title: Plain Text
docs.text:
add_a_title_to_your_code_block
This is plain text.
Nothing will be highlighted.

docs.title: Markdown
docs.text:
add_a_title_to_your_code_block
# This is a heading
- List item
- Another item

docs.title: HTML
C++
XML
JSON
YAML
docs.text:
add_a_title_to_your_code_block
name: John
age: 30

docs.title: TOML
docs.text:
add_a_title_to_your_code_block
[owner]
name = "John"

docs.title: CSV
docs.text:
add_a_title_to_your_code_block
name,age
John,30
Jane,25

docs.title: javascript
Content Tabs
docs.text: This is some examples of content tabs.

docs.title: Generic Content
docs.text:
Plain textUnordered listOrdered list

This is some plain text

  • First item
  • Second item
  • Third item
  1. First item
  2. Second item
  3. Third item

docs.title: Code Blocks in Content Tabs
Flowcharts
docs.text:
graph LR
  A[Start] --> B{Failure?};
  B -->|Yes| C[Investigate...];
  C --> D[Debug];
  D --> B;
  B ---->|No| E[Success!];

docs.title: Sequence Diagrams
docs.text:
sequenceDiagram
  autonumber
  Server->>Terminal: Send request
  loop Health
      Terminal->>Terminal: Check for health
  end
  Note right of Terminal: System online
  Terminal-->>Server: Everything is OK
  Terminal->>Database: Request customer data
  Database-->>Terminal: Customer data
